sen.j: 木寺宮康仁親王（きでらのみややすひとしんのう、元応2年（1320年）-正平10年/文和4年4月29日（1355年6月10日）は、南北朝時代の皇族で持明院統の光厳天皇の皇太子。
sen.e: Kideranomiya Imperial Prince Yasuhito (1320 - June 10, 1355) was the Imperial family in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties, and he was Emperor Kogon's Prince.

sen.j: だが、鎌倉幕府は今回の事件は大覚寺統全体が関与していないものであるから、後醍醐天皇と対立関係にある大覚寺統嫡流から皇太子を輩出して、引き続き大覚寺統と持明院統が交代で皇位継承（両統迭立）をすべきであるとしたため、持明院統もこれに同意して当時13歳の康仁親王の立太子を容認した。
sen.e: However Kamakura bakufu insisted that because this incident had nothing to do with the Daikakuji Imperial line, the Daikakuji Imperial line should appoint successor to the Crown Prince, and the Imperial succession should be shared between two parties in turns continuously, the Jimyoin Imperial line agreed to this and accepted Imperial Prince Yasuhito to become Crown Prince who was thirteen years old at that time.

sen.j: だが、翌1333年に後醍醐天皇側の反撃によって鎌倉幕府が滅亡すると、後醍醐天皇によって光厳天皇と康仁皇太子の否認（廃位、廃太子）が宣言されたのである。
sen.e: However on the following year, in 1333, after Kamakura bakufu died out after the attack of Emperor Godaigo's army, the Emperor announced not to accept Emperor Kogon to succeed to the throne and Imperial Prince Yasuhito become Crown Prince.

sen.e: There was a legend that Imperial Prince Yasuhito went to Irino (current Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture) of the manor of the Southern Dynasty, and established Ryoun-ji Temple, then he settled in to live there, there were the place where the Prince use to live, and his cemetery and his portlate remain within the temple.
